December 2, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
You are a continual inspiration to us for your
unselfish devotion and loyalty to a cause. I think
Professor Royce could have added a fine concrete illustra-
tion in his “Philosophy of Loyalty” if he had included you.

In this instance we shall apparently not need to
take advantage of your unselfish and thorough-going de-
votion. Doctor Hanson cabled from Lima under date of
November 18 as follows:

“Arrived here November 16th. After a close
investigation, I am of the opinion that case
reported Callao, Peru, was ill with malarial
fever. We think, however, that as a security
it is advisable to establish campaign here
until it has been proved there is nothing the
matter and we can hand work over to Government
about April. . . . . . . . . . . . . . .”.

There has not yet been time to have report of this
case by letter but a cable received yesterday indicates that
everything is satisfactory and states that the campaign has
Doctor Henry R Carter
December 2, 1921
2.
bee extended to Lima and Callao inclusive.

Thank you for sending the address of Doctor
Hanson before the Medical Association of the Canal Zone.
It is a more comprehensive account of the epidemic in
Peru than we had before received.
With warm personal regard, I am
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor Henry R Carter
2121 California Street N.W.
Washington, D.C.
